I've been playing this game for over a year on Playstation 4 and have racked up 141 hours through Steam, and I absolutely love this game! With its clever twist on horror and relatively unique asymmetry on teams, Dead by Daylight has provided challenging gameplay that feels rewarding when you succeed in its trials. While there are a lot of good pros, there are some difficulties that make the experience less than enjoyable, as they are outlined below.

Gameplay - 8/10
- For the most part, the game plays smoothly. Occasionally, there are game breaking bugs, but the devs are always working to fix and improve gameplay. Since the trials are heavily influenced by RNG, the general layout of the map can feel similar, but the placement of generators and totems are heavily luck dependent. Hitboxes are sometimes a bit farther out than they should be, leading to seemingly free hits for the killer, while sometimes running in circles can throw off the killer's swing, leading to annoyances for the Killer to take down someone right in front of them. Its biggest difficulty is how grindy it is. With 141 hours in, I have only gotten 6 of the survivors leveled up to unlock their teachable perks, and only 2 killers are also to that level. It can feel a bit discouraging, and when they do double bloodpoint events, it feels a bit closer to what I feel it should be, but it is still an overall great game.
Graphics - 9/10
- I really enjoy the artwork of the game and the use of its cosmetics. Excluding characters whose rights are owned by someone else, each character has a wide variety of clothing options, and the devs are always adding more to the game. Some clothes offer more stealth while others flaunt style, and the original character designs are usually fairly exciting. I dislike that most of it is hidden behind paywalls, particularly since the game itself isn't cheap if you want all the characters, but that is how the cookie crumbles.
Community - 6/10
- I would not say that this game is anywhere near the toxicity of MOBA games like League of Legends, but it does have its moments, particularly as you rise through the ranks. Mid-rank, Killers love to tunnel down on one survivor and camp to secure the kill, and survivors will tea bag at every pallet stun. Unless you play survive with friends, you likely have no idea the skill level coming in, and games can wildly swing back and forth in terms of who is favored to win. There is a bit of salt in the endgame if things were a bit too toxic, but I wouldn't say that games are not enjoyable. When I play killer, I try to play with the idea of being the game master, and if my survivors are not having fun, I haven't done my job (thanks to HybridPanda for that image). As survivor, I try to learn better ways of avoiding death, and try not to rub it into the killer when I survive. There are some handy resources out there to help on both sides, and the forums are mostly filled with handy information, not just the salt of players demanding balance.

Overall - 7.7/10
I still recommend this game, at least for 20 hours worth to try it out. I am not happy with some of the prices, and I feel frustrated at times when the game proceeds unfairly, but if you enjoy this type of game, it will lead to many fond memories!

Don't get this. The games amazing, but the devs don't listen and the updates are consistently 1/4 of the size of any other multiplayer game.

the devs consistently use the Player Test Build to not actually test their game or new updates but to just give players a sort of early access to the next update of the game. colourblindness support was never added or even thought about being added, until one of the devs said they were tired of people asking for it, which caused them to go into damage control mode and announce the next day that they had been working on it a long time now. They barely get anything done with their "major updates" with balance changes and stuff being so small when compared to 99% of any popular multiplayer game, (like seriously I think TF2 is the only game that does less updates than these devs) They changed the HUD and ignored the criticism that 90% of the community gave it, they're changing maps and ignoring the criticism that people are giving them, they do nothing but ignore everyone that likes this game and it doesn't look like its gonna change.

Don't buy this game, It's great fun but its just not worth the amount of garbage the community has to go through.

Суровая правда о ДбД:
-Маньяк: сурвы не должны генрашить, юзать осколки, снимать под "часами" и использовать прочие перки для доминации.
-Сурвы: маньяк не должен кемпить и тунелить, брать порчу, ноед и тд)

Регулярно вам будет попадаться маньяк который будет кемперить и туннелить, так же как и играя за маньяка вам будут попадаться приседающие, пикающие фонариком, генрашеры которые сидят в дискорде и угорают с вас, как у вас не получается игра) 
Если вы ненавидите сурвов, майните Нюрсу(медсестру) после 100+ часов, вся ваша ненависть превратиться в сплошное удовольствие, и получите горящий пукан от сурва)
Играйте для удовольствия и не обращайте на все это внимания!)

Plus it gives you so many different survivor characters with different perks as well as so many killers with different perks. It's hard to compete with this game. Can't wait for more updates.

[h1] opinión [/h1]
Un un excelente juego de terror.
Este juego no te sacara muchos sustos, (eso depende de la situación) ya que no es un juego genérico de terror, si no que es más un juego de supervivencia, sigilo y un poco de terror.

Lo más cercano a un susto puede ser la sorpresa de tener al asesino muy cerca de ti sin darte cuenta y aparezca de la nada, si buscas un juego que requiera mucho trabajo en equipo, agilidad, mecánicas distintas con cada personaje o asesino, este definitivamente es tu juego.

[h1] Lo bueno [/h1]
- Variedad en cuanto asesinos y personajes.
- jugabilidad única
- Gráficos buenos (incluso en lo mínimo)
- Fácil de entender
- Puedes obtener puntos dentro del juego, los cuales te permiten comprar asesinos o supervivientes.
- Su comunidad es muy activa.
- La conexión puede depender del asesino.
- Gran variedad de addons

[h1] Lo malo [/h1]
- Gente tóxica
- Campers, Tunnelers
- Actualmente se tarda al encontrar una partida como asesino.
- Las partidas te pueden tocar con todo tipo de jugadores. (Gente nueva o gente con mucha experiencia en este juego.)
- Algunos jugadores se desconectan en medio de la partida (lo cual le da desventaja a los supervivientes y ventaja al asesino) pero eso no evita el hecho que puedes escapar y ganar como superviviente, aun que puede ser más difícil.

[h1] ¿Lo recomiendo? [/h1]
Si, este es un gran juego para publico casual y "competitivo" (Este juego no es muy competitivo que digamos, pero si le puede gustar a alguien que juegue muy seriamente.) y si juegas con amigos, la experiencia ser más agradable.

Edit 3 (razones del cambió, otra vez): Cambiaron los terminos de privacidad EULA. Ya no toman más información de la necesaria.
Para quem curte jogar um survival horror, cooperativo, este é o jogo! Excelentes personagens. O único contra na minha opinião, é que tem uns killers que são muito apelões.

Impossible to win in top MMR against SWF unless you're a tunnelling Nurse / Blight.

Over 70K players have dropped the game ever since they introduced MMR (Even though the devs claimed that they don't think the game is competitive) ???

The reason why so many players quit is because killers have started to realize how poorly balanced the game is once they reach the top peak of their hidden ELO (MMR).

Survivors probably quit because they're tired of how killers have to tunnel / camp in top MMR in order to secure kills. + pressing M1 on gens and running to pallets can get boring and certainly doesn't require much skill. Especially gen rushing.

This is coming from a guy who played this game since 2016, both KILLER and SURVIVOR somewhat equally.
